Description: Shoulder sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of bridled horse to left (part of head, neck, mane and top of raised knee on lower left remaining).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a parallel, see Athens 12713 in Boardman, J., Early Greek Vase Painting. London 1998, 171, fig. 348. For other examples of the horse facing left, see Oxford AN1896-1908-G.130.2 and 5.
Bibliographic references: Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 136, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.036) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
